About Me

Let me tell you a little about myself and what I do...

Programming has always been a joy throughout my life. From solving simple coding puzzles to working on complex projects, every minute spent coding was worth it. This is the one field where you can really build anything you can think of. I spend most of my free time working on projects and constantly learning new things. It is my goal to establish a solid career in application development.
~ Jesse Bailey

AA in Computer Science

Graduated Magna Cum Laude from Pensacola State College in December 2019

High School Diploma

Took courses on electronic circuits & design. Graduated from Rockbridge County High School in May 2012.

Responsive Web Design Certification

Successfully completed the 300 hour interactive course from freeCodeCamp. Completed October 2020.

Completed Online Courses

The Complete Web Developer in 2021

This course got me started in web development. I learned the basics of HTML, CSS, and Javascript. I learned the fundamentals on how the web works. This is where I built my first major project that used React and PostgreSQL.

JavaScript: The Advanced Concepts

In this course is where my understanding of JavaScript grew the most. I learned about advanced topics like closures, prototypal inheritance, and asynchronous programming. This is where I gained valuable insight on what makes good code.

Modern HTML & CSS From The Beginning

Here is where I learned more about modern CSS techniques to build responsive web pages. I worked with Sass to expand on native CSS to create beautiful webpages. Along the way I got to create animations and use transitions to make content more interactive.
